extendedMetadata.value: LO: 9.1: What key forces drove American expansion westward during this period?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: PRE 09 02

config.question: Which of the following areas of America witnessed a great increase in population during the period of 1800–1850?

choices.content: the lands between the Appalachians and the Mississippi
the lands along the Gulf of Mexico

answer_3.response: The focus of attention between 1815 and the 1840s was the nearer West, the rich agricultural lands between the Appalachians and the Mississippi that were inhabited by numerous Indian tribes. Settlers poured across the Appalachians and filled the agricultural heartland of the United States.

Settlers poured across the Appalachians and filled the agricultural heartland of the United States.
